result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex N. Hitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber privileges

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex N. Hitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alex N. Hitz in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Defendant Alex N. Hitz in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM160, 15CM28, 14CM248, 14CT79 @ 1:49 p.m. Agreement 14CT79 - plea to ct 1 , ct 2 dismiss BAC .103, 5 days jail w/ credit for 1 day served, $1379.00, 12 months revocation, 1 yr IID. Then 14CM248 will amend ct 2 to OWI 3rd, BAC .107, ct 3 dismiss, plea to ct 1 & 2, ct 2 - 45 days jail w/credit for 1 day served, consecutive to 14CT79, $1694, 24 month revoke, 24 months IID, AODA, Ct 1 - 60 days jail, consecutive to 14CT79 and to ct 2 of 14CM248. 15CM28 - all cts dismissed and read in. 15CM160 plea to ct 1 and ct 2, ct 3 & 4 dismiss and read in. 120 days jail on both cts, no credit for time served, consecutive to 14CT79 and consecutive to ct 2 in14CM248, but concurrent with each other and concurrent to 60 days in 14CM248, court costs, DNA sample and surcharges. Question by the Court regarding jail time. Atty Casey agrees with stated agreement. Def understands and agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. 15CM160 plea to ct 1 guilty. Ct 2 guilty plea. 14CT79 ct 1 guilty plea. 14CM248 ct 1 -guilty plea. Court grants motion to amend ct 2 to OWI 3rd. Guilty plea. 15CM160 cts 3 & 4 dismiss and read in. 14CT79 ct 2 dismissed and consolidated. 14CM248 ct 3 dismiss and consolidated. 15CM28 all cts dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Casey satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CM160 ct 1 OAR and ct 2 misd bail jumping. 14CT79 ct 1 OWI 2nd, and 14CM248 ct 1 misd bail jumping and ct 2 OWI 3rd. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Nothing by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Orders 14CT79 ct 1 5 days jail, credit for 1 day served, fine and costs 1379.00. 12 months revocation, IID 1 yr, effective upon application. 14CM248 ct 2 - 45 days jail w/credit for 1 day, consecutive to 14CT79,  $1694 fine and costs, 24 months revoke, IID 2 yrs, AODA and follow through. Ct 1 - 60 days jail, consecutive to 14CT79 and to ct 2, court costs . 15CM160 ct 1 - 60 days jail, consecutive to all others ordered today, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Ct 2 - 60 days jail, concurrent to ct 1 in this case, consecutive to all others ordered today, costs inc. DNA surcharge. No credit for time served. Huber. Bonds in 15CM160 and 15CM28 apply to fines and costs. Pmt plan for balance. Postconviction rights. Pmt plan, first pmt due 30 days after release from jail. 15CF224 called @ 2:29 p.m. same appearances. Def has received copy of complaint, reading waived, time limits for ph waived. Court reviews prelim rights. State moves to amend bond to $5000 signature with same conditions. Court finds waiver freely made.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

Defendant Alex N. Hitz in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CM160, 14CM248, 14CT79, 15CM28  @ 9:02 am. Atty Casey has copy of complaint, waives reading, & enters Not Guillty plea in 15CM160.  Court receives not guilty plea in all ct's.  State moves to forfeit bond, pending hearing. Court notes State's motion in 15CM28. Court sets bond $250.00 already posted w/condition. Status on all 4 cases.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
